results.title: First love
results.brief_description: First Love is a story about 2 teenagers, discovering “first love” and each others bodies. A secret meeting in a school workshop leads to an intimate encounter and the exchange of rings. A tale of discovery, exploration, facination and body piercing that has delighted film festival audiences in Australia, Sweden, Spain and the United States.

results.title: First it seemed kinda strange
results.brief_description: Les’s parents divorced five years ago and he then went to live with his mother. He visits his father and stepmother on weekends and vacations and seems to have adjusted to this arrangement. This film raises issues surrounding social awareness and self awareness; divorce; family roles and relationships; and communication. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: First impressions: a journey to the Pilbara, Western Austral
results.creator_credit: Perth Institute of Film and Television, Paul D. Barron, Paul Barron and David Rapsey
results.brief_description: Documents the ideas, stages and techniques involved in the creation of German-born Jorg Schmeisser’s etchings in the north west of Western Australia and their final execution in his studio in Canberra. The creative process is as much about Jorg’s relationship to the etching plate as with his interaction with the landscape.

results.title: First impressions
results.creator_credit: United States. Navy and Atlas Educational Films
results.brief_description: Made primarily to show how wartime office employees of the US Navy Department were to be introduced to their work by supervisors. Discusses reasons why new employees may not like their job and presents some primary steps in giving them a good first impression of their work.

results.title: First impressions
results.brief_description: This film is designed for use in training supervisors and junior managers in human relations problems. The film tells the story of two workers starting with a new firm. Both are looking forward to the work and believe that they now have the opportunity they have been looking for to make successful careers for themselves. The first part shows how frustration and disillusionment can arise through lack of care and thought on the part of the supervisor. It then shows how these bad impressions could have been avoided by proper handling of the situation.

results.title: First encounters
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Malcolm Smith, Karl McPhee and Ben Lewin
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Migrant experience”.
Deals with the initial experience of various ethnic groups as they encounter Australia’s developing society and culture particularly the nature of the welcome experienced. Addresses what it is like to change cultural milieux, how forms of prejudice fit within Australian history and examines where attitudes towards migrants have changed.

results.title: First days of life
results.creator_credit: Les Films du Levant, Boulton-Hawker Films and Claude Edelmann
results.brief_description: Shows the sequence of a natural childbirth, reviews all facets of the developing foetus and depicts some aspects of the development of the child to the age of three. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: First days (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Slater Film Productions, Lesley Hammond and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description: Looks at a school is South Australia where a policy of continual admission for five year olds is in operation. Shows the way in which the parents and the new child are put at ease by the principal and class. Indicates the sorts of adjustments required from both the new student and the teachers. Also looks at vertical and small groups, open plan classrooms and parental involvement. Written by Terry Jennings.
